subject: Critical Thinking
title: Diagnostic Reasoning: How Doctors Think
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Diagnostic Reasoning: How Doctors Think.

hook.text: A patient has a headache, fever, and stiff neck. A doctor considers 50 possible causes in seconds. How?

buildup.text: Doctors use differential diagnosis ‚Äî listing possible explanations and narrowing them through evidence.

discovery.text: Each test result eliminates some possibilities and raises others. It's abduction in real time.

twist.text: The saying 'When you hear hoofbeats, think horses, not zebras' is Occam's Razor in a lab coat.

climax.text: But rare diseases exist. The best doctors balance parsimony with pattern recognition and experience.

punchline.text: Diagnosis is detective work inside the human body.

quiz.question: What is differential diagnosis?
options: Treating all possible diseases at once
Listing and narrowing possible causes through evidence
